correction module¶

paper: Advancing Dynamic-Time Warp Techniques for Correcting Eye Tracking Data

in Reading Source Code

Author: Naser Al Madi email: nsalmadi@colby.edu or nsalmadi@seas.harvard.edu

correction.add_regs(corrected, regs, regs_indexs)[source]¶

reattach regressions to a list of fixations

Parameters:

  • corrected (list) – a list of fixations

  • regs (list) – a list of fixations that are regressions

  • regs_indexs (list) – a list of indices of the regressions

Returns:

results – a list of fixations with regressions reattached

Return type:

list

correction.between_line_regression(aois_with_tokens, regression_probability)[source]¶

function to generate fixations at the optimal viewing poisiton slightly to the left of the center of each word, also simulates BETWEEN-line regressions with a probability defined by the user

Parameters:

  • aois_with_tokens (pandas.DataFrame) – a dataframe containing the AOIs and tokens

  • regression_probability (float) – probability of regression

Returns:

fixations – a list of generated fixations

Return type:

list

correction.correction_quality(aois, original_fixations, corrected_fixations)[source]¶

returns the correction quality by comparing the original fixations to the corrected fixations

Parameters:

  • aois (pandas.DataFrame) – a dataframe containing the AOIs

  • original_fixations (list) – a list of original fixations

  • corrected_fixations (list) – a list of corrected fixations

Returns:

  • quality (float) – the correction quality as a percentage

  • results (list) – a list where 1 indicates a match and 0 indicates a mismatch

correction.correction_quality_line(aois, original_fixations, corrected_fixations)[source]¶

returns the correction quality by comparing the line of the original fixations to the line of the corrected fixations

Parameters:

  • aois (pandas.DataFrame) – a dataframe containing the AOIs

  • original_fixations (list) – a list of original fixations

  • corrected_fixations (list) – a list of corrected fixations

Returns:

  • quality (float) – the correction quality as a percentage

  • results (list) – a list where 1 indicates a match and 0 indicates a mismatch

correction.detect_between_regressions(fixation_list, line_ys)[source]¶

Detects between-line regressions

Parameters:

  • fixation_list (list) – a list of fixations

  • line_ys (list) – a list of line Ys

Returns:

returns True if there is a between-line regression, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

correction.detect_regressions(fixation_list, line_ys)[source]¶

detects if a list of fixations contains regressions

Parameters:

  • fixation_list (list) – a list of fixations

  • line_ys (list) – a list of line Ys

Returns:

returns 1 for between line regression, 2 for within line regression, 0 for no regression

Return type:

int

correction.detect_within_regressions(fixation_list, line_ys)[source]¶

Detects within-line regressions

Parameters:

  • fixation_list (list) – a list of fixations

  • line_ys (list) – a list of line Ys

Returns:

returns True if there is a within-line regression, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

correction.detect_within_regressions_arabic(fixation_list, line_ys)[source]¶

Detects within-line regressions in reading from right to left

Parameters:

  • fixation_list (list) – a list of fixations

  • line_ys (list) – a list of line Ys

Returns:

returns True if there is a within-line regression, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

correction.distance(fix1, fix2)[source]¶
correction.draw_correction(Image_file, fixations, match_list)[source]¶

Private method that draws the fixation, also allow user to draw eye movement order

Parameters:

  • draw (PIL.ImageDraw.Draw) – a Draw object imposed on the image

  • fixations (list) – a list of fixations

  • match_list (list) – a list of matches (1) and mismatches (0)

correction.draw_fixation(Image_file, fixations)[source]¶

Private method that draws the fixation, also allow user to draw eye movement order

Parameters:

  • draw (PIL.ImageDraw.Draw) – a Draw object imposed on the image

  • draw_number (bool) – whether user wants to draw the eye movement number

correction.error_droop(droop_factor, fixations)[source]¶

Introduces a slope/droop distortion to the fixations

Parameters:

  • droop_factor (float) – droop factor

  • fixations (list) – a list of fixations

Returns:

fixations – a list of distorted fixations

Return type:

list

correction.error_noise(y_noise, fixations)[source]¶

Introduces a noise distortion to the fixations

Parameters:

  • y_noise (int) – noise in the y direction

  • fixations (list) – a list of fixations

Returns:

fixations – a list of distorted fixations

Return type:

list

correction.error_offset(x_offset, y_offset, fixations)[source]¶

Introduces an offset distortion to the fixations

Parameters:

  • x_offset (int) – offset in the x direction

  • y_offset (int) – offset in the y direction

  • fixations (list) – a list of fixations

Returns:

fixations – a list of distorted fixations

Return type:

list

correction.error_shift(y_shift_factor, line_ys, fixations)[source]¶

Introduces a shift distortion to the fixations

Parameters:

  • y_shift_factor (float) – shift factor

  • line_ys (list) – a list of line Ys

  • fixations (list) – a list of fixations

Returns:

fixations – a list of distorted fixations

Return type:

list

returns a list of word centers

Returns:

results – a list of word center coordinates

list

correction.find_word_centers_and_EZ_duration(aois)[source]¶

returns a list of word centers along with durations for each word based on the EZ Reader model

Parameters:

aois (pandas.DataFrame) – a dataframe containing the AOIs

Returns:

results – a list of word center coordinates and EZ reader durations

Return type:

list

correction.find_word_centers_and_duration(aois)[source]¶

returns a list of word centers along with synthetic durations for each word based on the length of the word

Parameters:

aois (pandas.DataFrame) – a dataframe containing the AOIs

Returns:

results – a list of word center coordinates and durations

Return type:

list

correction.find_word_centers_and_duration_MET(aois)[source]¶

Parameters:

aois (pandas.DataFrame) – a dataframe containing the AOIs

Returns:

results – a list of word center coordinates and durations

Returns:

fixations – a list of generated fixations

correction.generate_fixations_left_regression(aois_with_tokens, regression_probability)[source]¶

function to generate fixations at the optimal viewing poisiton slightly to the left of the center of each word, also simulates regressions with a probability defined by the user

Parameters:

  • aois_with_tokens (pandas.DataFrame) – a dataframe containing the AOIs and tokens

  • regression_probability (float) – probability of regression

Returns:

fixations – a list of generated fixations

Return type:

list

correction.generate_fixations_left_skip(aois_with_tokens, skip_probability)[source]¶

function to generate fixations at the optimal viewing poisiton slightly to the left of the center of each word, also skips short words with a probability defined by the user

Parameters:

  • aois_with_tokens (pandas.DataFrame) – a dataframe containing the AOIs and tokens

  • skip_probability (float) – probability of skipping a word

Returns:

fixations – a list of generated fixations

Return type:

list

correction.generate_fixations_left_skip_regression(aois_with_tokens)[source]¶

function to generate fixations at the optimal viewing poisiton slightly to the left of the center of each word, also skips short words with a fixed probability and simulates regressions with a fixed probability of 0.04

Parameters:

aois_with_tokens (pandas.DataFrame) – a dataframe containing the AOIs and tokens

Returns:

fixations – a list of generated fixations

Return type:

list

  • aois (pandas.DataFrame) – a dataframe containing the AOIs

correction.overlap(fix, AOI)[source]¶

Checks if a fixation is within an AOI

Parameters:

  • fix (list) – a fixation

  • aois (pandas.DataFrame) – a dataframe containing a single AOI

Returns:

results – True if the fixation is within the AOI, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

correction.slice_regressions(fixation_list, line_ys)[source]¶

splits regressions from the rest of the fixations

Parameters:

  • fixation_list (list) – a list of fixations

  • line_ys (list) – a list of line Ys

Returns:

  • only_regressions (list) – a list of fixations that are regressions

  • without_regressions (list) – a list of fixations that are not regressions

  • regs_index (list) – a list of indices of the regressions

correction.slice_regressions_arabic(fixation_list, line_ys)[source]¶

splits regressions from the rest of the fixations in reading from right to left

Parameters:

  • fixation_list (list) – a list of fixations

  • line_ys (list) – a list of line Ys

Returns:

  • only_regressions (list) – a list of fixations that are regressions

  • without_regressions (list) – a list of fixations that are not regressions

  • regs_index (list) – a list of indices of the regressions

correction.warp_regs(error_test, line_ys, word_centers, algorithm)[source]¶

hybrid(warp+chain) algorithm that applies warp to non-regressions then chain

Parameters:

  • error_test (list) – a list of fixations

  • line_ys (list) – a list of line Ys

  • word_centers (list) – a list of word centers

  • algorithm (function) – a function that takes a list of fixations and a list of line Ys and returns a list of corrected fixations

Returns:

results – a list of corrected fixations

Return type:

list

correction.warp_regs_chain(error_test, line_ys, word_centers)[source]¶

hybrid(warp+chain) algorithm that applies warp to non-regressions then chain

Parameters:

  • error_test (list) – a list of fixations

  • line_ys (list) – a list of line Ys

  • word_centers (list) – a list of word centers

Returns:

results – a list of corrected fixations

Return type:

list

correction.warp_regs_chain_arabic(error_test, line_ys, word_centers)[source]¶

hybrid(warp+chain) algorithm that applies warp to non-regressions then chain for reading from right to left

Parameters:

  • error_test (list) – a list of fixations

  • line_ys (list) – a list of line Ys

  • word_centers (list) – a list of word centers

Returns:

results – a list of corrected fixations

Return type:

list

correction.warp_regs_regress(error_test, line_ys, word_centers)[source]¶

hybrid(warp+regress) algorithm that applies warp to non-regressions and regress to the regression

Parameters:

  • error_test (list) – a list of fixations

  • line_ys (list) – a list of line Ys

  • word_centers (list) – a list of word centers

Returns:

results – a list of corrected fixations

Return type:

list

correction.warp_regs_regress_arabic(error_test, line_ys, word_centers)[source]¶

hybrid(warp+regress) algorithm that applies warp to non-regressions and regress to the regression for reading from right to left

Parameters:

  • error_test (list) – a list of fixations

  • line_ys (list) – a list of line Ys

  • word_centers (list) – a list of word centers

Returns:

results – a list of corrected fixations

Return type:

list

correction.within_line_regression(aois_with_tokens, regression_probability)[source]¶

  • regression_probability (float) – probability of regression
